abstract: In The New York Times on Friday, Brian X. Chen reports on "hacker hostels," apartments in the San Francisco Bay Area that offer short- or long-term stays for aspiring tech entrepreneurs on the bottom rung of the Silicon Valley ladder, those who haven't yet achieved Facebook-level riches. These establishments put a twist on the long tradition of communal housing for tech types by turning it into a commercial enterprise.

headline.main: Daily Report: Hostels for the Hopeful Young in Silicon Valley
